title: @Meddler, Could we get some Context on the Zyra Changes on the PBE?

embed.description: This is a W ORK I N P ROGRESS POST.] [ Status: The PBE currently still down for maintenance.] The PBE has been updated! As we kick off the 7.11 PBE cycle, tonight's update includes new X skins, Continue reading for more information!

body:
I'm just trying to wrap my head around what these changes are hopping to achieve and I can't work it out at all. 

These changes increase her reliance on her RNG passive which is a low-point of her design, make her plants even squishier so ambient AOE damage blows them up in mid but makes them more frequent so support Zyra can spam them out 24/7 to harass even more making playing against a Zyra support even more miserable.

I just can't see anything positive in these changes, to me it seems like they're actively pushing Zyra in the wrong direction.

replies.body:
Happy to give context. Our goal here is to improve the early level laning experience against Zyra without harming her experience or changing her play later in the game. It's easy to have the changes sunset as Zyra gains levels, the challenge is making 1 hit plants work for Zyra in lane from levels 1 to 5. 

The main controls on Zyra's plants are fun, power, and frustration -- getting a good exchange rate. If we can make plants less frustrating for the enemy, we can get more power and fun. The same HP that lets plants survive at all lategame makes fighting them in lane crazy. Fixing this bit of derp buys us a fair bit. 

So what do we buy? Plant damage! Plants are core to Zyra's identity and we've just made them cheaper. We spend that power back into the plant system, giving Zyra a bigger garden and so conditionally more damage-- about 50% more plants overall in lane. The linked article is missing that bit of the changes -- Garden of Thorns is much more likely to spawn two seeds at once when Zyra is low level. 

For Zyra, it's functionally equivalent to making the plants squisher and more dangerous. For enemies, it lets them play too -- the plant damage starts higher and it's more often smart to fight them some. Balance wise, our intent is to keep her at current power levels, so further changes are likely to be along those lines.
Do you have any value scale for the passive's change ?

> [{quoted}](name=Kaori MÄ±yazono,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lwbYeTWi,comment-id=00050002,timestamp=2017-05-17T21:10:11.441+0000)
>
> Do you have any value scale for the passive's change ?

From levels 1-5, the passive will spawn two seeds (very) roughly about 1.5x as often. From levels 6-10, around half that. It varies a ton circumstantially, that's for the overall output.

That sounds horrible. You seem to be missing that the biggest problem with Zyra currently and your entire ~~gutting~~ rework is the god damn RNG. It feels bullshit for both Zyra's players and her enemies and you're ramping it up? Just no. If you're going to do anything more with Zyra it should be a total passive rework to get rid of the garbage RNG. Maybe then she'd feel a lot less frustrating.
Just to sum up all of the posts here and on reddit, "varies a ton circumstantially" is the one thing nobody is happy with.
Truest comment of 2017

Can i ask what this means for leveling abilities in your opinion. Specifically in terms of comparing mid and support Zyra. Does this mean that as support, it would be better to put points into W earlier? Or do these changes not affect how Zyra levels her abilities whether it be in solo or duo lane?

> [{quoted}](name=20thCenturyFaux,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lwbYeTWi,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2017-05-17T20:32:34.552+0000)
>
> Happy to give context. Our goal here is to improve the early level laning experience against Zyra without harming her experience or changing her play later in the game. It's easy to have the changes sunset as Zyra gains levels, the challenge is making 1 hit plants work for Zyra in lane from levels 1 to 5. 

Then nerf the spawn rate on her passive. The 1-hit plants won't work. 

> The main controls on Zyra's plants are fun, power, and frustration -- getting a good exchange rate. If we can make plants less frustrating for the enemy, we can get more power and fun. The same HP that lets plants survive at all lategame makes fighting them in lane crazy. Fixing this bit of derp buys us a fair bit. 

Like everyone has said since this rework was announced, the **frustration** to both the enemy and the Zyra player is in the passive RNG.  You're addressing the enemy frustration by making the plants irrelevant but without acknowledging the existing frustration to Zyra players. If anything, making the plants die in one hit just compounds the frustration.

> So what do we buy? Plant damage! Plants are core to Zyra's identity and we've just made them cheaper. We spend that power back into the plant system, giving Zyra a bigger garden and so conditionally more damage-- about 50% more plants overall in lane. The linked article is missing that bit of the changes -- Garden of Thorns is much more likely to spawn two seeds at once when Zyra is low level. 

You're saying "damage" but describing RNG. We rely on the player-controlled W seeds to function, and those plants now die in one hit. Those plants aren't doing more damage, they're doing less (or none). 

> For Zyra, it's functionally equivalent to making the plants squisher and more dangerous. For enemies, it lets them play too -- the plant damage starts higher and it's more often smart to fight them some. Balance wise, our intent is to keep her at current power levels, so further changes are likely to be along those lines.

How are the plants more dangerous? The AI nerf wasn't reverted. The damage and scaling weren't changed on the PBE. So what are you talking about when you say "plant damage starts higher?"

Other concerns:

1) **We want more access to W seeds, not RNG**

2) Are you going to revert the Q mana cost if we have to spam it to spawn 1-hit plants?

3) Is the plant health on R passive or only for enraged plants?

4) Will it be possible for Zyra to function in the presence of a damage aura (eg Hec, Cinder, etc)?

5) The goal of these changes was supposed to be accomplished with the 50% nerf to plant duration in the rework. If they die in one hit, what's the justification for a 5-7.5 second duration instead of flat 10 second duration?

In no particular order: 

The R plant Health bonus applies to all plants once R is learned. 

Q mana cost is something we've got our eye on, that's decently likely to change. You're right that the pressure to reduce duration in lane is gone, only restricting factor left would be lategame zoning with Rylais and Liandry. Could see this being a good place to buff solo lane Zyra since plant duration in lane would mainly benefit minion control. 

Higher plant damage comes from there being more when they spawn. Typically this is most impactful when spawning several plants at once. W seeds are placed at times where the opponent is under the highest pressure, and so least able to attack, making Health less important for them. 

Unless she's laning against the damage aura that won't change at all. Laning against it, aoe periodic does partial damage to plants so it'd depend on how quickly it ticks.

Speaking of solo lane Zyra:

Many of us would like her to be balanced around mid. That was her original intent and we asked for it before the rework. She's such a fun champion and balancing her around support is sucky.

You never answered the most important question:

How are you going to address the RNG issue Zyra has? I hate it. The people playing against me hate it.

I want more control over where I place plants, not random seed diarrhea that happens to pop up in the right spot so that I can vomit my abilities out.

>Could see this being a good place to buff solo lane Zyra since plant duration in lane would mainly benefit minion control.

A far better way to buff solo lane Zyra would be to let her plants actually have some AP scaling.

Currently it takes 760 AP to double the damage on her plants, want to know why Zyra's not played mid? It's because she doesn't actually gain anything since her ratios are utterly pathetic.

Super easy answer. W stores more max seeds but W goes on cooldown for 5 seconds after planting two seeds within a 5 sec window.

So you have the normal seed recharge cooldown, and then a short cooldown to prevent her from dumping like 5 seeds under a Q.
Agreed, just as I mentioned too. :)

A few questions based on this response:

> The R plant Health bonus applies to all plants once R is learned.

Does this mean that the plants only gain that health when paired with her ultimate? Or will the plants have increased health once she learns R, regardless of if the plants are placed with the ultimate?

> Higher plant damage comes from there being more when they spawn. Typically this is most impactful when spawning several plants at once. W seeds are placed at times where the opponent is under the highest pressure, and so least able to attack, making Health less important for them.

The problem for Zyra players is that we often have no control over the passive seed spawns. In solo lane, they can spawn behind tower, on the sides of lanes, and even in jungle camps. None of those seed spawns are helpful when laning. Additionally, against assassins, it's really important that the seeds be clustered closer to zyra...it's how she survives. Unreliable passive spawns are problematic when you make changes that rely precisely on that mechanic.

i don't really think you play zyra if you think this is a good idea lol. you almost never want multiple plants because they do reduced damage when there's more than one of them attacking a target. you typically only want more plants when you're going for an all in with your ult or a gank after you land the snare. having the plants die in one hit means that they will at best get two autos off and in most cases just one... 
zyra being a support also means that she'll almost never reach level 16 to begin with to make up for these nerfs, and it's still not a lategame buff because you removed the scaling health on her w that allowed her to reach 6 plant health. the only buff present is the spawn rate being higher, but who cares if you can spawn two plants at a time when it takes an auto from each enemy laner to effectively destroy ur only source of relevance or damage in lane phase until you hit 6, at which point the lane phase is almost over anyway and you've been completely incapable of doing what zyra does: bully, because the rework shoehorned all of her relevance into plants that will now die in a single auto attack during the most crucial part of the game for zyra, the part where she builds a lead and rolls with it.

> Q mana cost is something we've got our eye on, that's decently likely to change. > Higher plant damage comes from there being more when they spawn. W seeds are placed at times where the opponent is under the highest pressure, and so least able to attack, making Health less important for them. 

If plant hp is back to live values at level 6, my complaint is irrelevant. You said you're wanting to keep her power level consistent with live. I do think this is a pretty big nerf to her early poke, but a ton more seeds and double-spawns overall sounds like a large buff to mid/late game and objective control. When you say "power level," are you just referring just to damage output or also her windows of opportunity to deal that damage?
Please make Zyra more of a midlaner than a support. It's been years that you've tortured us like this. Please.

I disagree with the plant changes. Any character with a D.O.T such as Hecarim W, Amumu W, Singed Q etc, pop plants instantly already which feels really crappy. These plants do not move and are stationary so they should be a lot more durable than getting 1 auto in lane since you can get out of their range.

Regarding more damage through her passive spawning, that passive is really useless except for helping your jungler level 1 with his buff. These plants never ever spawn in a suitable place and honestly this "passive" should have been slapped on her W. You claim to be giving more "damage" through her passive spawning seeds but these are honestly just frustration factors for the Zyra (speeds never spawn in places you'd want them) and the enemy (randomly getting two seeds on you just because of luck).

I honestly think this is going to take away enjoyment from Zyra, yes she is frustrating to play against but so are many champions out there. This will not take away frustration factor as much as you think, Zyra will still be Zyra and will be annoying to verse.

Do not put power you take away into her passive. It does not provide any meaningful gameplay for both the Zyra player and her opponents.

While I'm obviously going to be biased, I dont see why current zyra plants are considered too frustrating, they no longer autofocus champions which was  a change I completely agreed with. 
In order to get them to target champions you either have to auto the champion (autoing adc's as a support is fairly high risk into alot of matchups) or you need to hit your spell. 
Zyra already pays for her plant damage in the lower base damages on her Q and E compared to most mages and especially most mage supports.
If you compare her bread and butter harass spell to karma, or brand, or vel koz, it is  20 damage lower early game  in exchange she gets a conditional success case which is either gated behind a long cooldown (W) or dependant on a random passive which barring very lucky spawns can be seen on the ground and taken into account. 

My main concern with this change is that zyra is a lane bully, that is what she is picked for and what she is useful for in the current game, putting the opposing adc behind. If this goes through to live she will be a complete liabilty to pick into any kind of shield or healing support will sustain their adc through the poke and the pressure you are putting out will be offset by the fact your feeding them 10-15 gold every time you try to harass them. 

Ultimately I feel that If you really want to make this change work I think you need to look at the amount of gold offered up to the enemy adc for almost free by plants. either removing it or reducing it to 2-3 gold, they gave 5 gold before her rework when they were 10 second duration 6 hp tick pains in the ass, if they are going to die to a single autoattack 5 gold is way too much of a reward,  at least until you get the first point in ultimate.

Finally, while what I have to say about your reasoning may be negative thank you for taking the time to explain to us where your coming from, and I'm assuming if your reading this listening to our feedback.

We spend that power back into the plant system, giving Zyra a bigger garden and so conditionally more damage-- about 50% more plants overall in lane. The linked article is missing that bit of the changes -- Garden of Thorns is much more likely to spawn two seeds at once when Zyra is low level.

The RNG on her passive is still the worst thing about Zyra. The fact that you're increasing her reliance on it will end up making her both more frustrating to play and play against.

As someone that has mained Zyra for quite some time and only really play her mid, I feel like i should put my two sense in and say how i feel before its too late. I feel like with where this is headed Zyra is being set up for failure in mid lane. See the overarching problem with whats happening is she is having power pulled from certain areas and further put into her RNG passive. This is the core problem i think that is happening. The randomness of her passive is what makes her so mindless and while I think that having more plants is awesome, I would much rather have more control of where those plants are going then just have them randomly dropped. I think a better change would be to instead give her more seed charges. So she can have like 5 seeds or something with her w could even have W charges scale with ranks in w. I dont think shifting power into her RNG mechanic is healthy for her in terms of playing her and playing against her. 
Please don't ruin Zyra... If you wanna lower her plant health and let her spawn more.... Let her have control of where she spawns those plants... through W. This adds a skill implement and gives her much needed power in mid lane and still achieves the goals you guys are looking for.

I would have liked to see riot move her into the opposite direction from what they are doing now. Instead of more random seeds and weaker plants, they should have made plants stronger but have there be less of them imo. 

I regret all the complaints i ever had about the old passive cuz this illaoi knockoff of a passive is frustrating, and they are only making it worse at the cost of her plants health.

When they were doing the First Rework I suggested they make her plants have 2 forms each.

You have a One Seed short lived plant (like we have now) and a two seed plant (where you use W to upgrade a seed).  The Two Seed plant lives longer and does some kind of CC or Utility (healing allies near it every time a enemy unit dies near it that kind of thing)

Then you have the Random seeds from passive but you can amp the ones that spawn where you like them or use your W to make two seeds at once.

Is there any way Zyra mid can get some help? I understand her support may be strong but further nerfs to mid lane is unneeded.I see this creating more issues than what it solves. The plants already die too fast, if they decrease the health any lower they are going to have to put the duration back to what it was before the rework. Literally no one is asking for her rng seeds to pop out faster, im not sure why this is even a change. 

I whole-heartedly agree with the ult changes though, because her ulted plants are supposed to be super versions of her regular ones but they die just as fast. IMO they should keep the ult change and scrap everything else.
